link.title: Chequamegon Early Learning Center - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: On Friday, March 13, 2020, Governor Tony Evers directed Department of Health Services Secretary Andrea Palm to issue a statewide closure of all public and private schools for pupil instruction and extracurricular activities as part of the state’s efforts to respond to and contain the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin. The mandated closure of schools began on Wednesday, March 18 until further notice. Updates will be communicated as they're available.

div.a: Chequamegon School District

img.alt: Elementary students watch the high school band tour the hallway during Homecoming
Glidden Campus students playing a math game

div.div: Missing - Ms. Zwicke and Mr. Augustine

img.alt: The district and the community gather to celebrate the boys & girls cross country teams on their advancement to the WIAA state tournament

div.a: 420 9th Street North, Park Falls, WI 54552

p.strong:
Since you are visiting our webpage you may be wondering,
"What makes the Chequamegon School District special?"
CSD has five unique schools on two different campuses that are part of the largest district in the state:

li.strong: Park Falls Elementary: Consistently named an Academic "Beating the Odds" School by the Department of Public Instruction.
Glidden Elementary: Challenging, effective multi-age strategies are used in this small school setting.
Chequamegon Middle School: What if this age-group could have a "school to themselves"? We made that a reality, with excellent results!
Chequamegon High School: Named One of "America's Best Schools" by USA Today!
Class ACT Charter High School: "Recognized statewide as a high-quality, project-based learning lab school."

p.strong: We are also part of the Rural Virtual Academy (RVA) consortium, which may be of interest to home-school families.
Please explore our website, or better yet, come visit us in person. We would love to tell you about the great things that are happening in the CSD!

span.strong: OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OUR COMMUNITY WHICH INSPIRES STUDENTS AND PREPARES THEM FOR GLOBAL SUCCESS

a.span: April Regular Board of Education Meeting

CSD Storytime: "Purple, Green, and Yellow" by Robert Munsch & Hélène Desputeaux, read by Carrie Olson

span.p: It's CSD Storytime! Each day, we will feature a family-friendly story read by one of our talented staff members. Each video will post around 1 p.m. each day on the Park Falls Elementary School & Chequamegon Middle School Facebook pages. Links will also be available via the news feeds on all Chequamegon School District websites.
